definition: to come/to arrive/to come round/ever since/next
Italy/Italian/abbr. for 意大利[Yi4 da4 li4]

sentences.english: When they heard what he had come for, they were greatly pleased, and promised him money;
sentences.chinese: 听到他的来意后，他们非常高兴，答应给他赏钱。

sentences.english: He leaned on the desk and declared his intentions to the clerk.
sentences.chinese: 他靠着桌子向店员说明了来意。

sentences.english: I have heard some malevolent misrepresentation of her.
sentences.chinese: 我听到一些来意曲解她的话。

sentences.english: To coal companies who export to the Tang Wang Shunli explained what the guard.
sentences.chinese: 来者向唐口煤业公司门卫王顺利说明来意。

sentences.english: I have come quite simply, to ask you a great favour.
sentences.chinese: 我的来意很简单，先生，是来请您帮忙的。

sentences.english: Reporter thereupon marks a standing and explains purpose, the of"Wang Da Dun Xian" is embarrassed.
sentences.chinese: 记者随即表明身份，说明来意，“王大仙”顿显尴尬。

sentences.english: The woman set down her bag and set forth her purpose in coming.
sentences.chinese: 这名妇女放下她的包后阐明了她的来意。

sentences.english: You face underhand manoeuvres often, enough you sense when somebody isn't being entirely forthright about their intentions.
sentences.chinese: 面对来意不明的对手的时候你总是趋于防守止步不前。

sentences.english: When we mentioned what we had come for, they immediately offered to help us.
sentences.chinese: 当我们谈明来意之后，他们立即提出要帮我们的忙。

definition: inside information/the ins and outs of the matter/how things stand/what's up
to introduce oneself/originally a theatrical device in which a character explains his own role
lit. to open the door and see the mountain; fig. to get right to the point (idiom)
overtones in conversation/things indirectly implied from what is said
to pass on a story/to communicate a message
cause and effects (idiom); entire process of development
